newsitem.title: USA: Komag stock dives on earnings warning.
newsitem.headline: Komag stock dives on earnings warning.

text.p: The stock of Komag Inc., a maker of components for computer disk drives, lost nearly 34 percent of its value Thursday after warning that its results for the latest quarter and the year would disappoint Wall Street.
Komag fell by $8.1875 to $15.375 in early morning trading on the Nasdaq market.
The San Jose, Calif.-based company said late Wednesday that it expected to earn less in its second quarter than the 33 cents a share reported in the first quarter due to lower sales of disk drives.
Wall Street analysts had expected Komag to earn 45 cents a share in the second quarter.
The company reported sales of $167.2 million and income of $17.8 million in the first quarter.
Komag also said that its results for the rest of the year would fall short of expectations.
It expects to announce its quarterly results on July 17.
